sections.content:
2️⃣ **Harness your Social Media** 2️⃣ 

"Module 2 - Harness your Facebook" <:Facebook:1151543720911577159>

•




"Welcome"

Ready to get started?

A Yes-
B No

•


2️⃣ **Part 2** 2️⃣ 

"Business Account"

**Summary:**
- Setting up a business account keeps your work separate from your personal account

**Action steps:**
- Create a business account

•




"Create Page"

**Summary:**
- A page is where you will post your content and engage with your clients
- Fill in all of the relevant information for your page and add a call-to-action button
- You want to connect with people who are actually in your target demographic

**Action steps:**
- Create a page

What is the username of the accounts show in the video?

A Russian Tutor -
B Skydestroyer
C Michelangelo

•




"Health of Page"

**Summary:**
- Fill in as much information as you have but if you don’t have it, mark it as completed

**Action steps:**
- Complete the health check

•




"Settings"

**Summary:**
- It’s a good idea to tell Facebook that we’re here to make money
- Creating a username allows people to tag your page
- If you can only offer your services in a certain location, you can restrict your reach to people in that area

**Action steps:**
- Set a username
- Add any restrictions you need

Why are we not learning about every feature that Facebook has?

A Some tools don't work properly
B We are only concerned with how to earn moneybags -
C There will be a second course to go over more features

•


3️⃣ **Part 3** 3️⃣ 

"Connect Your Instagram and Whatsapp"

**Summary:**
- To harness everything Meta provides, you can cross-promote between their platforms

**Action steps:**
- Connect your Instagram and WhatsApp accounts

•




"Connect Socials"

**Summary:**
- You can add contact details to your info box - other social media, website, email etc.

**Action steps:**
- Add any other contact methods to your page

•




"Metaverse"

**Summary:**
- Meta Business Suite is the reason why Facebook is so good
- The planner shows your posts and allows you to schedule posts
- You can post to Facebook, Instagram or both with customization between platforms
A/B testing allows you to test different styles of the same post to see what works best
- Scheduling posts in advance can save you time and stress

**Action steps:**
Schedule a month’s worth of posts

•




"Stories and Reels"

**Summary:**
- You can schedule any type of post including reels and stories - better to create stories on Instagram

**Action steps:**
- Schedule a story and reel

•




"Chat Feature"

**Summary:**
- In Meta Business Suite, you can access a powerful inbox to handle all the messages you get
- You can get a link to give people to send you a message
- The chat feature allows you to prepare answers to common questions so people can get instant answers

**Action steps:**
- Setup some FAQs for your chat

•




"Chat Automation"

**Summary:**
- Facebook likes it when pages respond quickly (15 minutes or less) but you might not be available all the time
- You can set up automation to send automatic responses instantly

**Action steps:**
- Create automation to respond when you’re unavailable

**How do you answer all of the messages?**

(replies, comments, DMs, etc)

 a All of your messages will be in your inbox and you can also leverage the chatbot with pre-determined questions and answers.-
b Expect to spend hours replying to potential clients there is no way around this
c Hire a VA to reply to the messages

•


4️⃣ **Part 4** 4️⃣ 

"Services on Page"

**Summary:**
- You can add your services to your page so that people can see what you offer
- You can integrate third-party apps into your page such as booking systems
- You can check what your page looks like as a normal viewer

**Action steps:**
- Add your services to your page
- Add a booking system to your page

•




"Products on Page"

**Summary:**
- Adding products to your page can start making some passive income
- If you have a third-party eCommerce site already, you can integrate it with your page

**Action steps:**
- Add your products

**What is the purpose of adding products to your page?**

a To add passive income -
b Because you need to have your page filled with icons
c We are setting up an E-Commerce site

•


5️⃣ **Part 5** 5️⃣ 

"Harness Facebook"

**Summary:**
- Organic growth: posting good content
- Paid growth: paying Facebook to put your posts in front of people
- Quality is more important than quantity
- Let Facebook know who you’re looking for

**Action steps:**
- Continue the course

•




"Join Groups"

**Summary:**
- You tell Facebook who you’re interested in by following and engaging with them
- Search for groups by your demographic and join them
- Sometimes you will have to fill out a questionnaire to join a group

**Action steps:**
- Join groups relating to your demographic as your page

•




"Follow Pages"

**Summary:**
- As your profile, you should also join demographic groups but also follow pages
- Show Facebook that you really want to be involved with your demographic

**Action steps:**
- Join groups relating to your demographic as your profile
- Follow pages relating to your demographic as your profile

•




"Share Posts to Groups"

**Summary:**
- Click Share > Share to Group
- Only share one post 10 times per day to avoid being seen as a spam bot
- Act like a person, not a bot - randomize your sharing and posting

**Action steps:**
- Share your posts to groups you joined

•




"Comments on Posts"

**Summary:**
- To organically create a lot of exposure, you can comment
- First follow or join, then like, then leave a comment
- People actually read through all of the comments
- The aim is to start a thread
- Reply to comments
- Have a look through the comments and see what gets likes and replies
- The owner of the post might see you as spam and block you

**Action steps:**
- Send 1 comment and 5-10 replies per post

**How many times should you post per day?**

a 1-2 -
b 2-3
C 3-4
d 4-6

•


6️⃣ **Part 6** 6️⃣ 

"Ads Manager"

**Summary:**
- You must follow all the rules and regulations for your area for what you can post as an ad
- Campaign: what is the goal of the ad
- Ad sets: can have different types of ads
- Ads: individual ads
- ROAS: Return on Ad Spend - you should weigh up if spending more than you make is worth it

**Action steps:**
- Continue the course

•




"Create a Campaign"

**Summary:**
- Make sure you deal with any red or yellow alerts
- Define the goal of your campaign
- You have control over what you want to spend
- It is important to create a specific audience
- Find the right balance between too broad and too specific

**Action steps:**
- Set up an ad campaign

•




"Facebook Pixel"

**Summary:**
- You want to get as much data into Facebook as possible
- You might have other places where people interact with your business outside of Meta
- On your website, you can add a pixel to give data to Facebook when people interact there
- Use a different pixel for every asset; website, store etc.

**Action steps:**
- Add a Facebook pixel to your website

Are you going to implement this course?

A Of course
